heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 09 November 2025 with a total accumulation of 47.89mm over 144.8 hours and falling at a rate of 24.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 34.3mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 144.8 hours on 09 November 2025 when 47.89mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 24.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: A storm is passing through the area.  This marks the first storm since 02 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 3 so far this year, while the average is 3.6.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 0 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (199°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 27 January 2026 with a value of 128.2 mph.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the inside temperature (down 2.6°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 0.8 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (down 1.8 mm), cloud levels (up 197 m), feels like temperature (down 2.7°C), and outside temperature (down 2.0°C) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 59.1m lower than yesterday, 197.5m lower than the past week, 183.3m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 523m to 933m and averaged 585.0m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; relatively cool weather. Outside; cold weather is expected. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and near calm conditions. Showers, overcast skies with low cloud, and it’s dark. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: The current weather conditions are not suitable as it is raining.
